column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A :
#Text=I have been involved in all levels of politics from a very early age and have a bachelors degree in political science for The University of Western Ontario .
#Text=I have also been a Brampton resident for over 30 years .
#Text=I am not a rookie .
#Text=I care about this city and the people who live and work here .
#Text=I want to put people back as top priority in any political agendas and decision-making .
#Text=Q : The Rose Theatre recently launched .
#Text=What are your thoughts on this facility ?
#Text=Have you had a chance to tour it yet ?
#Text=A : Yes , I have toured the theatre .
#Text=It is beautiful from the inside out .
#Text=I love the name as it coincides with Brampton 's history .
#Text=To date , the theatre is operating on budget and I hope it will continue .
#Text=I commend the theatre group for attracting very popular entertainment .
#Text=We must watch the theatre closely and work with local media and community groups to ensure its continued success .
#Text=Q : The province has strongly encouraged the development of high-density residences near the downtown .
#Text=Do these buildings fit in with your vision of the downtown ?
#Text=How much say should other levels of government have in urban planning ?
#Text=A : I have been a resident of downtown Brampton for over 13 years .
#Text=The development of high-density residences in downtown Brampton is of great concern to the residents and to me .
#Text=Potential problems with increased traffic , crime and pollution must be addressed at the onset of any decision-making .
#Text=Improving public transit within Brampton and with GO Transit is a priority and the establishment of parking areas for the residents of these new buildings is key .

#Text=I appreciate the feedback and recommendations of both provincial and federal governments in urban planning , however , we must fight for what is right for Brampton and its ' residents first and foremost .
#Text=Q : How do you feel about Brampton 's rate of expansion ?
#Text=Council recently capped the annual amount of new development ; do you agree completely with this decision , would you have slowed development even further , or not have imposed a cap at all ?
#Text=A : The current council allowed the growth of Brampton to get out of control to begin with .
#Text=Capping the growth rate now is another example of reactive governance .
#Text=However , it is the only option to best manage a bad situation .
#Text=With more effective planning in the building of major roads , park lands , schools and recreation centres that meet the needs of the community , there would have been no reason to impose a cap.
#Text=Q : Why should businesses be attracted to locating in Brampton ?
#Text=A : Brampton is ideally situated near many major road access routes .
#Text=It has an excellent labour pool with the full range of general labour to high in demand skill sets .
